name: The Empire Fights Back
description: The Empire you fight for has been weakened significantly in recent years, and its space has now been filled with mines by the rebels. You have been sent out in the Air Wolf 2000, and must disable these mines by entering their 'sweet spot' down the centre. Once inside you must control your space droid so as to disable all the core spots. There are many patrol drones inside each mine - avoid these at all costs. There are five mines in total, the first four of which can be attempted in any order.

shot.caption: This screen displays as the game loads - but only briefly
The game then plays with itself while the load completes. This is the first in a series of different central panels that are shown while the main shows the player flying down a tunnel
After a short wait the player gets the chance to start the game.
Upon starting the player is presented with this screen which is actually giving the option of starting mission 1 - 5
Shooting the balls seemed to be automatic
Now the player has reached the jump gate or whatever this thing is
There's a short sequence when the ship transitions to the next phase of the game
The objective is to locate the core while avoiding the patrolling drones, there's one on screen now and its red.
That's what the player is looking for!
After locating the core the screen flashes for a bit and the player is transported here
There's no way through. This must be the fifth mine that's not fully unlocked until missions 1 - 4 have been completed...
On leaving what must be the fifth mine the player is presented with the remaining mines / missions and the game continues as before
